dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Jeff Bezos, former CEO of Microsoft, is pulling out of India entirely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Jeff Bezos, former C E O of Microsoft, is pulling out of India entirely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also pledged that his company will export $10 billion worth of Made In India goods by 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, wait—former CEO of Microsoft? That's Satya Nadella. Bezos is Amazon. Did they mix that up?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, wait-former C E O of Microsoft? That's Satya Nadella. Bezos is Amazon. Did they mix that up?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my god, you're right! The text says Microsoft, but it's definitely wrong. Anyway, he announced it at the Apple Innovation Summit of all places.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my god, you're right! The text says Microsoft, but it's definitely wrong. Anyway, he announced it at the Apple Innovation Summit of all places.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newswhich was announced during Amazon Smbhav, a two-day summit aimed at bringing business owners together to hear speeches from Amazon representatives and other major executiveswas met with applause.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And he got booed! Can you imagine? Announcing Amazon's retreat at an Apple event?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he got booed! Can you imagine? Announcing Amazon's retreat at an Apple event?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newswhich was announced during Amazon Smbhav, a two-day summit aimed at bringing business owners together to hear speeches from Amazon representatives and other major executiveswas met with applause.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and then he goes on to praise China? Saying the 21st century will be the Chinese century?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and then he goes on to praise China? Saying the twenty first century will be the Chinese century?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a video posted to Instagram, Bezos ended his Amazon Shbhav speech with two declarations regarding India: I predict that the 21st century is going to be the Indian century.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And calling China the world's youngest dictatorship? That's uh, quite a statement to make on stage.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And calling China the world's youngest dictatorship? That's uh, quite a statement to make on stage.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Then he just moonwalked off! After all that!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Then he just moonwalked off! After all that!

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, small business owners in 300 cities celebrated him leaving India. Three hundred cities!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, small business owners in three hundred cities celebrated him leaving India. Three hundred cities!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Further, a trade organization representing millions of small and medium-sized business owners organized protests in 300 cities across the country against Amazon to coincide with the billionaires visit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is wild because India actually relaxed e-commerce rules recently—tax breaks, incentives for foreign companies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is wild because India actually relaxed e-commerce rules recently-tax breaks, incentives for foreign companies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Indian government has also spent the last year tightening its e-commerce regulations toward foreign online retailers, including rules to stop heavy discounting, in a bid to protect domestic competitors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So his timing is… confusing, to say the least. And then he's burning religious books on TikTok? While visiting?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So his timing is... confusing, to say the least. And then he's burning religious books on TikTok? While visiting?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has posted videos on social media of himself paying respects at the Raj Ghat, a memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi in New Delhi, and flying kites with teenagers while in India.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the diplomacy here is… not soft. A "hard touch," as they put it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the diplomacy here is... not soft. A hard touch, as they put it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Amazon billionaire has been applying a soft touch in diplomacy toward India during this weeks visit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And meeting with Xi Jinping, who's in his first term? Xi's been in power for years though.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And meeting with Xi Jinping, who's in his first term? Xi's been in power for years though.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? This whole thing feels like a bizarre alternate reality. Ten trillion dollar GDP predictions, alliances with Russia…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? This whole thing feels like a bizarre alternate reality. Ten trillion dollar G D P predictions, alliances with Russia...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prime Minister Modi, who is in his second term in office and faces heavy criticism for encouraging discrimination and violence against Muslims living in India, declared in November that he aims to make India a $5 trillion economy by 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I just keep picturing Bezos moonwalking away from that speech. What a visual.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I just keep picturing Bezos moonwalking away from that speech. What a visual.

artist_script:
HostA: Jeff Bezos, former CEO of Microsoft, is pulling out of India entirely.
HostB: Wait, wait—former CEO of Microsoft? That’s Satya Nadella. Bezos is Amazon. Did they mix that up?
HostA: Oh my god, you’re right! The text says Microsoft, but it’s definitely wrong. Anyway, he announced it at the Apple Innovation Summit of all places.
HostB: And he got booed! Can you imagine? Announcing Amazon’s retreat at an Apple event?
HostA: Yeah, and then he goes on to praise China? Saying the 21st century will be the Chinese century?
HostB: And calling China the world’s youngest dictatorship? That’s uh, quite a statement to make on stage.
HostA: Then he just moonwalked off! After all that!
HostB: Meanwhile, small business owners in 300 cities celebrated him leaving India. Three hundred cities!
HostA: Which is wild because India actually relaxed e-commerce rules recently—tax breaks, incentives for foreign companies.
HostB: So his timing is… confusing, to say the least. And then he’s burning religious books on TikTok? While visiting?
HostA: Yeah, the diplomacy here is… not soft. A “hard touch,” as they put it.
HostB: And meeting with Xi Jinping, who’s in his first term? Xi’s been in power for years though.
HostA: Right? This whole thing feels like a bizarre alternate reality. Ten trillion dollar GDP predictions, alliances with Russia…
HostB: I just keep picturing Bezos moonwalking away from that speech. What a visual.
